creator: sebastian@nohn.net
text:
nohn_s@F70C3D5 /tmp/httpd-2.0.55
$ ./configure --enable-layout=/opt
sed: -e expression #1, char 25: unknown command: `o'
checking for chosen layout... /opt
checking for working mkdir -p... yes
checking build system type... i686-pc-cygwin
checking host system type... i686-pc-cygwin
checking target system type... i686-pc-cygwin

Configuring Apache Portable Runtime library ...

checking for APR... reconfig
configuring package in srclib/apr now
configure: error: expected an absolute directory name for --bindir: NONE/bin
configure failed for srclib/apr



$ sed --version
GNU sed version 4.1.4

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Hah, that had me looking confusededly at the configure script for a good ten
minutes.  /opt is not a valid layout name; I think you meant

  --enable-layout=opt

creator: sebastian@nohn.net
text: Ah, shit. Sorry for stealing your time :(
